tool.name: Generate conformers
tool.command: conformers -i '$infile' -if sdf -n '$num' -a '$attempts' -r '$rmsd' #if $conditional_cluster.cluster_method_opts != 'none' -c '$conditional_cluster.cluster_method_opts' -t '$conditional_cluster.threshold' #end if -e '$emin' -if sdf --meta -of sdf -o outp &>> $logfile && cat outp_metrics.txt &>> $logfile && gzip -d outp.sdf.gz

param.name: rmsd
param.label: RMSD threshold
param.help: If a conformer is too similar to those already generated (below the RMSD threshold), it is discarded and regenerated.

param.name: attempts
param.label: Number of attempts
param.help: Conformers which are below the RMSD threshold are regenerated. This parameter controls how many times this regeneration should be attempted before giving up.

param.name: cluster_method_opts
param.label: Cluster method
param.help: RMSD, TFD (torsion fingerprint deviation) or no clustering.

param.name: emin
param.label: Energy minimisation iterations
param.help: Number of EM iterations using the MMFF force field. Default is 0 (i.e. no EM).

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What this tool does**
This tool generates conformers for a set of input molecules, using the chemistry toolkit RDKit.
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Input**
| - Molecules in `SDF format`_ | - A number of other parameters can be set; the most important include the number of conformers to generate and the minimum RMSD difference between them.
.. _SDF format: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chemical_table_file
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Output**
SD-file containing generated conformers.
